intro: Fosterella chiquitana, commonly known as the Chiquitania pineapple. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae, native to northern South America. The plant is characterized by its rosette of spiky, fleshy leaves that form a central cup, which collects water. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Fosterella chiquitana is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests.
